column4: Can someone assist me with the package manager.  When I go to update I have three failed repos and have no idea why
which repositories
want me to paste them? there are 3
Just give the URLs, put them all on one line
Whoops, not quite one line
er... pastebin your sources.list
/etc/apt/sources.list
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/19722/
er... that's how it looks in the file?
the stuff at the bottom has those long lines like that?
yes, that was a straight copt and paste
odd.  Well, that explains why.  This is all screwed up.

I bet this happened when I was checking and unchecking options in my package manager.  I was only choosing different sources, but when i put them back, i was left with the errors.  I believe this is a bug
Are you able to provide the default sources.list file per chance?

yeah, thats what it looks like.  Uh, file a bug about it (https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/software-properties/+filebug) and include that sources.list with it (and instructions on what you did)
so, right now copy that sources.list down somewhere, since we'll be fixing it right now so you can have a wokring system.
in the process of doing just that.  How can i fix this in the mean time?
will do
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/19726/
replace your sources.list with that one.  You might need to re-start your editor with sudo (gksu gedit /etc/apt/sources.list)
Thanks! This worked wonders! Do you find it odd that my system is "up to date?"  I probably havent downloaded an update in about a week because of the messed up sources.list file i had
Thanks for the help! Much Appreciation
